text: Salsa improver #1 Place all of the chopped "extras" in a bowl  Pour the smooth pre-made salsa into the bowl.  Serve fresh with tortilla chips, cut up pita breads, crackers etc. When ready to eat, stir salsa for 1 minute. Salsa improver #2 Drain the liquid from corn and beans. Strain them, and also strain the salsa. Add the beans and vegetables to the skillet or frying pan. Heat on high. Stir frequently while it cooks. Add the seasonings and powder. Add the herbs, hot sauce and fruit to the pan when it begins to brown.  Cook for another 6 minutes or so until the fruit browns.  Pour the strained salsa into the mixing bowl. If using the cheese, mix through now. Tip the cooked ingredients into the salsa. Stir to combine well. Serve. Add the usual tortilla chips or corn chips. Salsa improver #3 Place a frying pan or skillet over medium heat. Add a little olive oil (not much, this will end up in your salsa). Chop the bell pepper and red onion roughly. Add the to the heating oil. Cook until browned. Remove and allow to cool. Add the salsa to a serving bowl. Squeeze in the lime juice and stir through. Add the cooked veggies. Stir though. Season with black pepper to taste.  Serve with tortilla chips or corn chips.
